content: 2 Listen, read and act out. Listen and chant. 1 2 1 2 Lingling went to London Town. She met John, a little boy. They visited the London Eye, and saw the city from above the ground. Lingling is in London with Sam and Amy. Amy: Hello, John. How are you? John: I'm fine, thank you. Y ou're back from China! Amy: Yes, we're home. John: Did you come back yesterday? Amy: No, we came back last Sunday. This is our Chinese friend, Lingling. John: Hello, Lingling. Lingling: Hi, John. Do you live in London too? John: Yes, I live near Amy and Sam. Unit 1 Did you come back yesterday?

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a

content: 3 1 1 t i n U 3 Lingling: Amy, look at those ice creams! Let's buy some. John: This is your ice cream, Lingling. Lingling: Thank you! Sam: We're going home now , John. Come with us. Amy: There's our bus! Finish your ice cream, Lingling. Lingling: Wait for me! John: Hurry up, Lingling. Run! Lingling: Oh no! I dropped my ice cream! John: Oh no! My new shoes! 4 Listen and say. Practise. 3 4 1 t i n U 1 John: Did you come back yesterday? Amy: No, we came back last Sunday. Lingling: Oh no! I dropped my ice cream! I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . Did you walk to school yesterday? Did you have rice yesterday? No, I came to school by bus. No, I had noodles yesterday.

content: 5 Unit 2 We bought ice creams. Look, listen and say. Listen and read. 1 2 1 Did Lingling phone you? No, she didn't. No, she didn't. Did she send you an email? Here's a postcard from Lingling. It's for you. Dear Daming, Yesterday I went to the park with Sam and Amy. We met John in the park. He's Sam and Amy's friend. We bought ice creams. Then we went home by bus. I ran to the bus. And I dropped my ice cream on John's new shoes! I was very sorry. Love, Lingling

content: 6 The London Eye goes round and round, round and round, round and round. The London Eye goes round and round, high up in the sky. The people on the Eye say, "Look at that! Look at that! Look at that!" The people on the Eye say "Look at that!" high up in the sky. THE LONDON EYE Listen and repeat. Listen and say. Then sing. Now answer the questions. 3 4 5 2 t i n U 1 Did Lingling go to the park yesterday? Did she meet John? Did they buy ice creams? Did they go home by bike? Did Lingling walk to the bus? Did Lingling drop her ice cream? I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . content: 7 Follow and say. Look and say. 6 7 1 2 t i n U Yesterday I bought an ice cream. Yes, we did. Yesterday Xiaohai bought an ice cream and I watched TV. Yesterday Xiaohai bought an ice cream, Lulu watched TV and I... Talk about a trip in class. Did you go there by train? Did you go to the Huangpu River? No, we went there by plane. I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . We went to Shanghai last Friday. We came back last Sunday.

content:
8 Look, listen and say. Listen, read and act out. Unit 1 What did you buy? 1 2 2 Mr Smart: Sam, go and buy some fruit, please. Here's the list. Sam: OK. Mr Smart: What did you buy? Where is the fruit? Sam: Er… Here! I ate it all. Ms Smart: We need food for our picnic. Mr Smart: I'll make a shopping list. Ms Smart: First, we need six bananas. Amy: Lingling likes apples. Ms Smart: OK, we can buy four apples. … At Home 
9 2 1 t i n U Mr Smart: How much cheese did she say? Amy: I don't know. At the Supermarket At Home Ms Smart: What did you buy? Mr Smart: We bought some apples. Amy: We also bought four pears. Ms Smart: How many bananas did you buy? Mr Smart and Amy: We didn't buy any bananas. We bought twelve eggs. Ms Smart: Twelve eggs? Oh no! Mr Smart: Oh no! I lost the list. How many apples did your mum say? Amy: Four apples.

content: 10 Listen and say. Practise. 2 1 t i n U 3 4 We didn't buy any bananas. We bought twelve eggs. How many bananas did you buy? I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . Yes, I bought six bananas. What did you buy? I bought five pears. Did you buy any bananas? 11 Look, listen and say. Listen and read. Unit 2 How much cheese did you buy? 2 1 2 Did Amy eat all the chocolate? Yes, she ate it all. How much juice did she drink? She drank it all. We need a big bag for our picnic. We can use the bag over there. How much juice did you buy? We bought two bottles. How much cheese did you buy? Half a kilo. And we also bought a lot of chocolate! How much chocolate did you buy? Half a kilo! We can eat some now!

Here's a big bag for you. How much milk ? How much juice? How much do you want? A bottle or two, a bottle or two? Here are two big bottles for you. H O w ma NY DO YO u wa NT ? n u mber m o ther b a nan a teach er b ir d n ur se I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . 13 Do and say. Now write and act. 2 2 t i n U 6 7 A: How many/much... did you buy? B: ... bananas did you buy? rice did you buy? I bought . I bought . Ask and answer about your shopping in Activity 6. I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . What did you buy at the supermarket? I bought some bananas and rice. 1 1 
14 Listen and chant. Listen, read and act out. 1 2 3 Where did you go? What did you do? Amy: Hello, Daming. How are you? Daming: I'm fine, thanks. What did you do at the weekend? Amy: We visited lots of places. What did you see? Please tell me. Unit 1 Where did you go?

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content:
15 3 1 t i n U LONDON Daming: Where did you go? Amy: We went to the British Museum. And we visited Big Ben and the London Eye. Daming: How did you go to these places? Amy: We went by bus. Daming: Did Lingling like the museum? Amy: Yes, she did. But she liked the bus ride best! Then we took a boat trip along the river. It took us one hour and twenty minutes. Daming: Mm, you had a good day! 
16 Listen and say. Practise. 3 4 3 1 t i n U I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . Where did you go last Sunday? What did you do? I went to... I... What did you do at the weekend? We visited lots of places. Where did you go? We went to the British Museum.

metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content: 17 Look, listen and say. Listen and read. Unit 2 Daming took a photo of his father . 1 2 3 Daming and his father went to the Great Wall at the weekend. They went to Badaling by bus. They arrived there at ten o'clock in the morning. The wall is very old and very long. They walked on the wall for one hour. There were lots of people. They took photos of the mountains with beautiful flowers and green plants. Daming took a photo of his father. Did Daming take this one too? No, this is Daming. And I took it. Who took this picture? Daming did. He’s my friend.

How did they go there? When did they arrive? What did Daming do? I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . content: 19 Make funny sentences. Do and say. 6 7 3 2 t i n U They went to school by plane. They saw monkeys there. Make a survey of trips. I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . Where did you go at the weekend? I went to Beidaihe. How did you go there? I went there by train. What did you do there? I went swimming in the sea.

content: 20 Look, listen and say. Listen, read and act out. 4 2 1 Unit 1 Mum bought a new T-shirt for me. Ms Smart: Do you like this pair of shorts, Sam? Sam: No, I don't want shorts. I want trousers. Amy: Mum bought new clothes for Sam! Lingling: Ha ha... Sam: That's my T -shirt! Amy: No! It's my T -shirt. Ms Smart: Don't argue! What's the matter? Amy: Sam took my T -shirt. He wants to wear it. Sam: But it isn't your T -shirt. Mum bought it for me. Amy: No, she didn't. Mum bought a new T -shirt for me.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content: 21 4 1 t i n U Sam: I'm so sorry, Lingling! Amy: I'm sorry too. Lingling: That's OK. Lingling: Look, this is my new kite. Amy: Oh, it's beautiful! Sam: The cat is so cute! Lingling: Let's go and fly it. Amy and Sam: Great! Ms Smart: Your red T-shirts are on the line. I washed them for you. Look! Sam: Did you wash Lingling’s T -shirt? Ms Smart: No, I didn’t. Lingling’s T-shirt is clean. She didn’t wear it. 22 Listen and say. Practise. 4 1 t i n U 4 3 Amy: Sam took my T -shirt. He wants to wear it. Sam: But it isn't your T -shirt. Mum bought it for me. Sam: Did you wash Lingling's T -shirt? Ms Smart: No, I didn't. Lingling's T-shirt is clean. She didn't wear it. No, she didn't. She bought new trousers for Tom. I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . Did Ms Smart buy new trousers for Daming? 22

content: 23 Hey, that's my bag! And those are my shoes! Thank you. Look, listen and say. Listen and read. Unit 2 What's the matter with Daming? 4 2 1 23 What's the matter, Ben? I lost my cap. Look! There is a cap. Oh, it's my cap! What's the matter with Daming? He lost his bag. What was in it? My new sports shoes. Look! I found this bag on the school bus. These new sports shoes were in it.

content:
5 1 t i n U Ms Smart: I bought twenty yesterday. Did I lose one? Amy: No, you didn't. There's one on the floor! Amy: Oh no! Sam: Oh, now there are twenty-one crayons! Sam: … eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen, fifteen, sixteen, seventeen, eighteen, nineteen. There are only nineteen crayons. But there are twenty children in the class! 27 
Listen and say. Practise. 3 4 5 1 t i n U There are twenty-one crayons. There are only nineteen crayons. But there are twenty children in the class. A: There are three crayons. B: But there are four children. I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . 28

content: 1 2 5 Listen and chant. Unit 2 There are forty. Listen and read. Numbers are having a party. Twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty and ninety. All of them are dancing happily. How many pupils are there in your class, Lingling? There are fourteen. Fourteen? Oh sorry. There are forty. Oh, there are so many! 29

Ninety birds and one hundred frogs. I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . content: How many people? Name Xiaowen ... Count and say. Do and write. 5 2 t i n U 6 7 One dog. Four legs. Three dogs. Twelve legs. I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . I c a n d o t h i s . How many people are there in your family? There are… Make a survey of families. 31 32 Look, listen and say. Listen, read and act out. Amy: Lingling, do you want to be in our football team? Lingling: Yes, I do . But I don't play well. Sam: Can you run fast? Lingling: No, I can't. Sam: Can you pass the ball well? Lingling: Not very well. 1 2 6 Can he play basketball? Oh, he can play it well! Unit 1 You can play football well.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content: 33 Amy: But you can jump really high! You're very good at basketball. Lingling: Yes, I am. Sam: And you can catch the ball well. Lingling: Yes, I can. Sam: So you can be a good goalkeeper. Lingling: Yes. I think I can do that well. Amy: Hooray! Lingling, you're a fantastic goalkeeper. I'm your first fan! Sam: You can play football well, Lingling. metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content:
76 The Twins and the Big Surprise A lex and Leo were brothers. They were twins, but they were very different. Leo was a very good boy. He worked hard at school. Every day after school he did his homework. He helped his mother. He played football with his father. A lex was different. He didn't like school. He didn't work hard. He was bored in class and he drew pictures. He didn't do his homework. He didn't help his mother. Reading for Pleasure 
77 "Y ou shouldn't draw pictures in class," said his mother. "You should work hard and do your homework," said his father. O ne day Alex and Leo were at school. Their mother was in their bedroom. She opened a cupboard. She saw a notebook and read it. It was a story with beautiful pictures. It was about a blind man and a kind boy. "My clever boy," said the mother. "My clever Leo can write interesting stories! He can draw very well too!" Reading for Pleasure

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content:
78 A t that moment Alex opened the door. "Alex," said his mother, "look, this is your brother's book. He wrote this story." "Do you like the story?" asked Alex. "Yes, I do. It's very good!" said his mother proudly. "T hank you," said Alex. "It's mine. I wrote it." Alex looked at his mother. His mother looked at him. "I'm glad you like my story," said Alex. T wenty years later, Alex became a famous writer. Reading for Pleasure 
79 Word List Word List twins （复数）双胞胎 surprise 惊喜 Alex 亚历克斯 Leo 利奥 different 不同的 work 工作；学习 hard 努力地 after 在……以后 drew （ draw 的过去式）画 shouldn't = should not 不应该 should 应该 cupboard 橱柜 notebook 笔记本 read （ read 的过去式）读 story 故事 moment 片刻，瞬间 wrote （ write 的过去式） 写 proudly 自豪地 mine 我的 glad 高兴的 later 后来，以后 became （ become 的过去式）成为，变成 writer 作家 Reading for Pleasure

metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content:
80 Draw and cut out circles from cards. Or use paper plates. Draw different faces on the cards or plates. The faces can be happy, sad, bored, angry, hungry or thirsty. 1 2 Are you drawing a happy face? I'm drawing a bored face. Yes, I am. Masks 
81 Cut holes for the eyes. Stick a pencil on the back to hold the mask. Decorate the masks with paper hair. 3 My mask is a girl. Look! She's got long hair. 4 
82 Play with your masks. Hold your masks and sing "You are happy". 5 6 A: I'm happy. B: I'm thirsty. C: I'm angry. ABC ABC A: I want to sing and dance. B: I want to drink some water. C: I want to stamp my feet. 
83

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）五年级上册_486aac2a.pdf

content: 既名为“后记”，一般应该是本教材使用完毕后才看到的吧。 那么，同学们，你们喜欢这套教材吗？大明、玲玲以及他们的小伙伴们是否让你们喜爱上了英语，并且帮助你们掌握了一定的英语运用能力呢？如果是这样，那就太好啦！希望你们在以后的英语学习中继续大胆地开口说英语——课上说、课下说；继续积极地参与各项语言活动。 一句话，你们要尽量主动使用英语来表达意思和做事情，这样才能把英语学好。 可敬的老师们，感谢你们的辛勤劳动，以及你们为国家英语课程改革付出的努力和做出的贡献。在修订本套教材的过程中，我们也充分考虑了英语课程改革以及一线教学的需求。修订后的教材更加突出了英语课程工具性和人文性的统一，优化了各册的结构设计和内容安排，以使教学脉络更加清晰、梯度更加合理。 为了在最大程度上保证教材与课程标准的契合，便于一线教学使用， 所有参与本套教材编写的人员均付出了艰辛的努力。在此我想特别感谢我的编写团队，没有他们的努力与付出，就没有本教材的问世。 本册教材的主要编写人员如下： 你们 的二 〇 一二年春日 Naomi Simmons （英） Judy West （英） Printha Ellis （英） Carlos Barcenas （英） Diana Pye （英） 张琦 兰虹 褚献华张琪珊英 语 （三年级起点）
